column4: ANyone have a suggestion on why websites won't load after a fresh install (10.04)? I've disable ipv6 and changed the DNS togoogle public dns. There are no proxy setting in the network setup or browser preferences.
can you ping anything?
yes, pinging in terminal is no problem
interesting
so you can ping www.google.com and it resolves and everything?
because I don't know why something like chrome wouldn't work then
yes, pinging google.com resolves with 2% loss
my wired connection actually seems to be ok
yes, that is clean
cool
so it's not ipv6.
if ethernet is working, it's (obviously) something related to your wi-fi, either your card, wi-fi-related software, multiple network setup stuff, or your router
maybe it's having trouble setting up your wireless interface properly
should I try setting the ipv4 setting manually?
It's possible, but I don't know why it'd work.
just trying different configurations isn't a bad idea
Are you dualbooting? If this problem persisted in e.g. Windows XP you'd know it was hardware
darn, I was kind of hoping it was hardware

I'm out of ideas, but I'm a little new to ubuntu so don't give up yet. Basically I would start looking into your specific wireless card/drivers (lspci for the card, lsmod for modules). I would also try disabling all network interfaces besides wireless and trying things out. Also compare windows/linux side by side, right next to the router....
after that I don't know... besides maybe trying 10.10 or 11.04
incidentally, why are you using 10.04?
you could try out natty's liveCD environment and see if the wireless works better
